descriptionSet.display: Wire recordings are analog magnetic recordings made on steel or stainless steel wire. They were a relatively short-lived medium, utilized primarily between 1946 and 1954, when magnetic tape became the preferred format.
descriptionSet.description: Wire recordings are analog magnetic recordings made on steel or stainless steel wire. They were a relatively short-lived medium, utilized primarily between 1946 and 1954, when magnetic tape became the preferred format.

locationSet.display: Middle Tennessee State University, Center for Popular Music. No publication information available.
